issue.title: [C++] Missing cast from timestamp to time64
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-13622](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13622). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
If the units are the same it should be a trivial cast.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13622?focusedCommentId=17398441) by Weston Pace (westonpace):*
I wasn't thinking straight.  Time64 is not a timestamp.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13622?focusedCommentId=17398477) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
We should have  a kernel to extract the time part of a timestamp, though (not sure if there is already a JIRA for it)

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13622?focusedCommentId=17398505) by Joris Van den Bossche (jorisvandenbossche):*
We have ARROW-13549 for that

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-13622?focusedCommentId=17398861) by Weston Pace (westonpace):*
Thanks for the info!
